revised_title: Exploring the Properties of Equations with Impossible Roots
tldr: The author presents a method for demonstrating Sir Isaac Newton's rule for finding when an equation has impossible roots. By using algebraic properties and geometric concepts, the author shows that the sum of the squares of the differences between four quantities is always greater than twice the product of any two of them. This method can be applied to quadratic and cubic equations with real roots, providing a deeper understanding of when roots are impossible.
